fields.description:
h3. Summary
Upon modifying Default Field Configuration, if there are two default field configurations in the database it will cause an exception and the list of field configurations will no longer display.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 1000.844.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* In the database: {code:sql}jira=> select * from fieldlayout;
 id   |                           name                            |                                 description                                  | layout_type | layoutscheme
-------+-----------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------+--------------
 10000 | Default Field Configuration                               | The default field configuration                                              | default     |
 12001 | Default Field Configuration                               | The default field configuration                                              | default     |{code}
* Modify Default Field Configuration in comment field, editing renderer to be wiki from text.

h3. Expected Results
Changes should be saved, however, cause issues:

h3. Actual Results
* Field configuration list will be blank, and also error on panel in issue: {noformat}Error rending 'com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.comment-panel:addcommentmodule'. Please contact your JIRA administrators.{noformat}
* Error in Logs: {noformat}2017-03-29 16:56:26.531945500 java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: com.querydsl.core.NonUniqueResultException: Only one result is allowed for fetchOne calls
2017-03-29 16:56:26.531976500 	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.reportGet(CompletableFuture.java:357)
2017-03-29 16:56:26.531976500 	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.get(CompletableFuture.java:1915)
2017-03-29 16:56:26.531977500 	at com.atlassian.workcontext.api.WorkContextExecutorFactory.awaitDetachedCommands(WorkContextExecutorFactory.java:106)

2017-03-29 16:56:26.531991500 	... 15 filtered
2017-03-29 16:56:26.531991500 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
2017-03-29 16:56:26.531991500 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
2017-03-29 16:56:26.531992500 	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
2017-03-29 16:56:26.531992500 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
2017-03-29 16:56:26.532001500 Caused by: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: com.querydsl.core.NonUniqueResultException: Only one result is allowed for fetchOne calls
2017-03-29 16:56:26.532001500 	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:207)
2017-03-29 16:56:26.532002500 	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.SwitchingCacheFactoryImpl$AtlassianCacheAdapter.get(SwitchingCacheFactoryImpl.java:202)

2017-03-29 16:56:26.532011500 	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.DefaultFieldManager.findVisibleFieldLayouts(DefaultFieldManager.java:498)

h3.Workaround
*Cloud Customers* Please contact Support to run the following fix:
# In JIRA Database, {code:sql}select * from fieldlayout;{code} in order to determine the id of the duplicate default renderer.
# Update the 2nd default to be null: {code:sql}update fieldlayout set layout_type = '' where id = [ID of duplicate];{code}
fields.summary: Duplicate Default Field Configuration causes exception

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If we create a webhook for the issue updated event with a JQL with 'changed after' and a relative time the event is not triggered on transitions that change the status. Example of JQL:
{code:java}project = TP AND status changed AFTER -2m
{code}
If we run the transition again, within 2 minutes, the webhook is fired, because, it seems, because it's able to see that the status in the previous transition.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a webhook for 'issue updated' and with this JQL: {{project = TP AND status changed AFTER -2m}}
 # In the TP project, select (or create) an issue whose status hasn't been changed in the last 2 minutes
 # Trigger a transition that changes status
 # Within the next 2 minutes: try again

h3. Expected Results

The webhook is triggered in both steps 2 and 4.
h3. Actual Results

Only second webhook in step 4 is triggered.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Transition doesn't trigger webhook if JQL contains 'updated after' with relative time

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Clicking on the drop down list for the labels suggestions returns a 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Open an issue in JIRA
- Click on Labels
- Click on the drop down

h3. Expected Results

Labels suggestions should be loaded.

h3. Actual Results

An error will be returned

 !error.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Labels suggestions fails to load

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A particular instance has a very large number of projects, screen schemes, and screens (~3200, ~1500, and ~4400 respectively), and as a result the Screens administration page in administration no longer loads (it sits there for 60 seconds then hits the Nginx timeout).

h3. Steps to reproduce
Create a large number of projects (each project adds its own workflow, screen schemes, and screens), try to view the Screens page. I don't know what the specific cut-off is, but it'll get to a point where it takes longer than 60 seconds.

h3. Notes
Taking a thread dump while it's loading, it's doing a bunch of database operations:

{code:none}
"http-nio-2999-exec-3" #175 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x0d67c000 nid=0x883 runnable [0x5ea02000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE

	at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(SocketOutputStream.java:109)
	at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(SocketOutputStream.java:153)
	at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flushBuffer(BufferedOutputStream.java:82)
	at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flush(BufferedOutputStream.java:140)
	- locked <0x8653e7e8> (a java.io.BufferedOutputStream)
	at org.postgresql.core.PGStream.flush(PGStream.java:508)

	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeQuery(SQLProcessor.java:633)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.createEntityListIterator(GenericDAO.java:967)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectListIteratorByCondition(GenericDAO.java:883)

	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OfBizWorkflowDescriptorStore.getWorkflow(OfBizWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.loadWorkflowDescriptor(CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.lambda$getWorkflow$0(CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore$$Lambda$836/11214876.get(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.CacheAdapter$2.lambda$get$0(CacheAdapter.java:95)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.CacheAdapter$2$$Lambda$504/4262164.get(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.lambda$get$1(DelegatingCache.java:186)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache$$Lambda$43/20711240.call(Unknown Source)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache$1.load(LocalCache.java:4742)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LoadingValueReference.loadFuture(LocalCache.java:3527)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.loadSync(LocalCache.java:2319)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.lockedGetOrLoad(LocalCache.java:2282)
	- locked <0x68bc9148> (a com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$StrongAccessEntry)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2197)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3937)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4739)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:173)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.CacheAdapter$2.get(CacheAdapter.java:95)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.getWorkflow(CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.JiraWorkflowFactory.getWorkflow(JiraWorkflowFactory.java:33)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.config.DefaultConfiguration.getWorkflow(DefaultConfiguration.java:89)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:188)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflows(OSWorkflowManager.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuefields.screens.ViewFieldScreens.getWorkflowTransitionViews(ViewFieldScreens.java:136)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56)
	at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:517)
	at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:216)
	at webwork.view.taglib.WebWorkBodyTagSupport.findValue(WebWorkBodyTagSupport.java:62)
	at webwork.view.taglib.BasicPropertyTag.doStartTag(BasicPropertyTag.java:54)
	at jsp.secure.admin.views.issuefields.screens.viewfieldscreens_jsp._jspx_meth_ww_005fproperty_005f5(viewfieldscreens_jsp.java:1327)
	at jsp.secure.admin.views.issuefields.screens.viewfieldscreens_jsp._jspService(viewfieldscreens_jsp.java:230)
	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:70)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:725)
[...]
{code}

Turning on SQL logging shows exactly what it's doing. First, a SELECT for every single screen:
{code:sql}
SELECT NAME, DESCRIPTION FROM public.fieldscreen WHERE ID='<id>'
{code}

Then every workflow:
{code:sql}
SELECT ID, workflowname, creatorname, DESCRIPTOR, ISLOCKED FROM public.jiraworkflows WHERE workflowname='<workflow name>'
{code}

Then every workflow draft:
{code:sql}
SELECT ID, PARENTNAME, DESCRIPTOR FROM public.jiradraftworkflows WHERE PARENTNAME='<workflow name>'
{code}

Then both screen items and field screen schemes:
{code:sql}
SELECT ID, OPERATION, FIELDSCREEN, FIELDSCREENSCHEME FROM public.fieldscreenschemeitem WHERE FIELDSCREEN='<id>'
{code}

{code:sql}
SELECT NAME, DESCRIPTION FROM public.fieldscreenscheme WHERE ID='<id>'
{code}

JIRA should probably implement some sort of pagination or streaming on the Screens page (and likely others).

h3. Workaround
View an individual project's administration that uses the screen you want to edit, and click directly through from there to be able to edit that particular screen.
fields.summary: Sufficiently large numbers of screens and workflows in JIRA Cloud can cause the Screens page in administration to become unviewable

h3. Summary

The Mail Queue Service fails to initialise correctly after an upgrade.
Outgoing Mails queue up in the queue and are not sent.
Customers don't receive notifications

     	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeLocalJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:410)

Please have the site Technical Contact raise a [Cloud Support request|https://support.atlassian.com] and provide the best time for a restart.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is deactivated, the webhook fires the _user\_updated_ event, but it doesn't mention that the user was deactivated. It only sends the _self_, the _name_, the _key_, the _emailAddress_ and the _displayName_.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Webhook with all user related event
# Go to the User Management and deactivate a user

h3. Expected Results
The Webhook sent should mention the user was deactivated
h3. Actual Results
Nothing is mentioned about the deactivation of the user
fields.summary: Webhook for deactivated user doesn't say the user was deactivated

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the notification sent to the users generate their first password, the button *Set my password* does not work since it contains the {{os_username}} url parameter that has been blocked as documented in the [JIRA and Confluence Cloud os_username and os_password embedded in URL no longer available|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/jira-and-confluence-cloud-os_username-and-os_password-embedded-in-url-no-longer-available-872007971.html] KB article.

Indeeed, when clicking on the "Set my Password" button the users are sent to a link like the below one:
- {{https://INSTANCE_NAME.atlassian.net/secure/ResetPassword!default.jspa?os_username=USER_NAME&token=SOME_TOKEN}} 


h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud 1000.747.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Invite a new user to the instance, e.g. by using the REST API endpoint  /rest/api/latest/user (sending the parameter "notification":"true").
# The user that got invited opens the "Account created" notification and click on the *Set my password* button

h3. Expected Results
The link open correctly and the user is able to set the password

h3. Actual Results
The below message is returned:
{noformat}
REQUEST DENIED. Refer to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/JIRA+and+Confluence+Cloud+os_username+and+os_password+embedded+in+URL+no+longer+available for details.
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
Depending if your instance is using [Atlassian Accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Purchasing/Introducing+Atlassian+account] or not, you can either:
- Use the password reset link that is present at the bottom of the notification.
- Reset the password from https://NAME.atlassian.net/login/forgot
fields.summary: The the os_username parameter has been blocked but it is still used in the users onboarding notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When performing a migration to JIRA Cloud the site reindex that normally runs in 30 minutes is now taking hours to complete. JIRA is doing 1% reindex every 10-20 minutes.

Note: The problem was originally found on imports but it is now found to be also affecting Background reindex.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud since v1000.610.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start a JIRA import

JIRA is imported and the reindex takes 30 minutes or less (depending on size of import)

{noformat}
h3. Notes

Same result for JIRA imports with or without attachments
h3. Workaround

The cause of this have been traced to applinks that are timing out during resolution. Before running any imports or reindexes look in the Application Links administration section for applinks that are unable to resolve and remove them. If importing from a server instance into a cloud instance remove any applinks that will not be able to resolve from a cloud instance (e.g. any firewalled resources) before performing the export. If you need assistance with this please contact the support team.
fields.summary: Reindex is slow and takes several hours to complete

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issue collector can't be created due to certain field without any error thrown to provide explanation unless user change the issue type. Once the user change issue type, similar error like below will be thrown:
{noformat}*Error*

You cannot create an issue collector for this project, because the following fields are required on the project and those field types cannot be displayed to anonymous users. If the field is changed to be optional or a default value is provided, then an issue collector can be created for the project. Not allowed fields: Assignee
{noformat}
Prior to that, clicking on *Submit* won't do anything.

 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Have a JIRA instance with *Allow unassigned issues* turned off to create a condition where Assignee is required.
 # Create a project.
 # Try to create an issue collector for the project using normal admin user - not sysadmin.
 # Change issue type to view have the error.

h3. Expected Result

The error should be thrown after clicking *Submit* or even earlier.
h3. Current Result

The error is not visible no matter how many times the user clicks to submit - only visible once issue type is changed.

 

*Note*: This doesn't seem to affect user with system administrators access. In Cloud, that would be *sysadmin*.
fields.summary: Issue collector can't be created due to certain field without any error thrown properly

fields.description:

h3. Environment

Cloud - JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.653.0

Cloud - JIRA v1000.552.3
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a service desk/software issue, please open in global issue view
 # try to open project or issue dropdown from the top menu bar

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown should be displayed normally
h3. Actual Results

The dropdown not appear
  
h3. Workaround

Use other browsers (safari and google chrome works)
fields.summary: Issue and project dropdown doesn't display on firefox

fields.description:
Basically if you create an issue link to an external website such as [https://google.com|https://google.com/] and then you inspect the element it will not have the "external-link" class applied to it. This is inconsistent with how links are handled in the rest of Atlassian applications.

If you put the same link into a comment or description you will see that it will have the class correctly applied to it.

 

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Go to a issue and click [...] -> Link
 # On the Link dialog, add a new web link, eg: [https://gooogle.com|https://gooogle.com/] and save.

 

*Actual Result:*

When inspecting the element of the added link, they do not contain the "external-link" class.

 

*Expected Result:*

The "external-link" class is present, similar to how the links are handled in the rest of the Atlassian Applications.
fields.summary: External issue links don't contain the correct class

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Edit the announcement banner at {{/secure/admin/EditAnnouncementBanner!default.jspa}}.
# Click the little wiki markup preview button.

h3. Expected results
A preview of what the rendered wiki markup will look like is shown, same as with comments and the description field.

h3. Actual results
Absolutely nothing happens. There's no errors in the Javascript console either.
fields.summary: Announcement banner's wiki markup preview button does nothing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In older versions or JIRA, any operation in repositories linked in JIRA, apart from showing in linked issues, would also appear in the 'Activity' tab in that issue. This is shown below:
!commit_activity_tab.png|thumbnail!

So, committing with the following comment should both appear in the 'Development panel' and in the 'Activity' tab. However, this is no longer happening and operations in the repository (such as commit) are not showing in 'Activity' tab.

When testing on '7.1.0-OD-02-025' I can see the data there. Version '7.1.0-OD-05-006' is not showing it anymore


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a clean JIRA instance in version 7.1.0-OD-05-006
# Link using DVCS account to a BitBucket account
# Commit to a repository with a smart commit and an issue key in the commit message (don't add any operations such as '#comment')

h3. Expected Results
The commit should appear in the 'Development panel' and the operation in the 'Activity' tab in this issue.

h3. Actual Results
Although it appears in the 'Development panel' nothing is shown in 'Activity'.
 
h3. Notes
If you add some operation like '#comment', the operation itself is shown in 'Activity', but nothing mentions a new commit in the repository

h3.Workaround
No workaround so far.
fields.summary: Operations in repository are now showing up in 'Activity' tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After performing a JIRA Site Import and a Confluence Import from another instance the remote links from JIRA to Confluence display 'Page Failed to load' as both the appId and pageId have changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create instance-a containing JIRA Cloud and Conlfuence Cloud
# On instance A create an issue and then refer to that issue from a Confluence page
# Take a site backup and space backup of JIRA and Confluence
# Import the JIRA Site backup into instance B
# Import the Confluence space backup into Instance B.
# View the JIRA Issue on instance B

h3. Expected Results

A remote link to the page on instance B exists.

h3. Actual Results

The remote link on instance B says:

{quote}
Page Failed to load
{quote}

If you check the database the pageId and appId will not match the space export.

h3.Workaround

As both the pageId and appId have changed it's nearly impossible to map the pages back in any automated fashion. Recreating the links will be your best option.
fields.summary: Remote links fail to load after any confluence import due to changing appId and pageId

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 15 August 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for voting and watching this issue over the last few days. We have read your comments and recognise the inconvenience this has caused.

We are now working on reverting the change that removed the "Import issues from CSV" menu entry. You can expect it to show again within the next couple of days.

Heads-up that this functionality might get moved to another place in the UI in the near future. We will make sure that it will still be accessible to users without admin permissions and that the change is then properly documented for users.

Thanks for your patience and understanding.

Kind Regards,
Daniel Franz
JIRA Product Management
{panel}


h3. Summary

The option to import using CSV from the *Issues* tab at the top blue bar is missing.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud version {{1000.245.0}}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to a Cloud instance
 # Click on *Issues* on the top blue bar
h3. Expected Results

!csv import.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

!csv missing.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use the CSV importer from the *External Importer* by navigating to:
 * https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa
fields.summary: Import issue from CSV missing from Issue tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Cloud User Management prevents the creation of new users if you're trying to set up the new user using another existing user's email address, and/or change an existing user email to an email that is already being used by another user.
But if you go to JIRA's user profile, https://<Cloud instance URL>/secure/ViewProfile.jspa, the user can actually change its email address to an email that is already being used by another user, and this change will be reflected in the User Management.
h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud version 1000.855.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 users, each one with a different email
# Log in as user one and navigate to its JIRA profile page (Click the profile picture > Profile)
# Change the email address to the one being used by user two

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should prevent this update because the email of the user two is already being used by user two.
h3. Actual Results
User one is allowed to update its email to user two's and this change is reflected in the User Management.

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: JIRA User Profile allows you to update the user's email address to an existing email from another user

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure a Mail Handler
# Try creating a ticket via email with file of about 8Mb attached to the mail


h3. Expected Results

The issue is successfully created and the file is attached to the mail.

h3. Actual Results

The issue creation fails.
 
Return mail reports: 

{noformat}Technical details of permanent failure:
Google tried to deliver your message, but it was rejected by the server for the recipient domain instance.atlassian.net by mx-103.ash2.uc-inf.net. [xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx].

The error that the other server returned was:
552 5.3.4 Message size exceeds fixed limit{noformat}

h3. Notes

Increasing the attachment size limit doesn't fix the issue

h3.Workaround

None so far.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud mail server rejects attachments that are less than the JIRA maximum attachment size

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customer cannot search for issues using this JQL: worklogDate < '2016-10-16'

*Note:* The problem only happens using this specific date. If you change *16* for *17*, it works properly. Also, if you let the day as *16* and change the mounth to *09*, it works as well. 

*The problem seems to be vey restrict to this date: '2016-10-16'*

h3. Environment

* JIRA v1000.383.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on 'Issues'
# Click on 'Search for Issues'
# Fill the field with: *worklogDate < *'2016-10-16'* and press Enter.

h3. Expected Results
The filter should bring the logged issues before the specific date: '2016-10-16'

h3. Actual Results
The error message: Date value '2016-10-16' for field 'worklogDate' is invalid. Valid formats include: 'YYYY/MM/DD', 'YYYY-MM-DD', or a period format e.g. '-5d', '4w 2d' as follow the screenshot:

 !date_error.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
*The problem only happens with this specific date.*

h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: Customer cannot search for issues using this JQL: worklogDate < '2016-10-16'

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a Business project with a JIRA Core Board.
# Create two issues in that project.
# Create a new user, assign one of the tickets created above to that user.
# Click "Find issues" at the top-right, then click "Assigned to me" (it works as expected and shows only the one assigned issue).
# Edit the new user's username and change it to something different, then log back in with that account.
# Click the "Assigned to me" link on the board again.

h3. Expected results
It works as in Step 4 above.

h3. Actual results
No issues are displayed.

h3. Note
The same result also happens for the Due this week filter.
fields.summary: Assigned to me filter on JIRA Core Board returns no results when username has been changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a sub-task from an issue in JIRA, the sub-task being created is not logged in the main ticket history


h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.110.0
JIRA Agile v1000.0.9-D20160627T082418
JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-17-002-D20160627T071458


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket or open an existing ticket
# Click the 'More' button
# Click Create sub-task


h3. Expected Results
The main ticket history should track that a sub-task was created


h3. Actual Results
The main ticket history does not show any sub-task was created

 
h3. Notes
Subsequently, if you link a ticket to another ticket, the issue being linked will display in the tickets history


h3.Workaround
The only workaround would be to link the issue or create a sub-task and then add a comment to the ticket stating there was a sub-task created
fields.summary: Sub-task creation is not tracked on parent issue history

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After an Cloud maintenance, when JIRA is upgraded, the URL, generated by the Backup Manager, is removed.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Trigger a JIRA backup                                                  
 # Confirm the backup has finished and the URL is available 
 # Check for URL the next day                      

h3. Expected Results
The URL of the backup is still available.
(since the backup file is valid for seven days)

h3. Actual Results
The URL of the backup is not available anymore, if an upgrade was performed.

h3. Workaround
None
Please raise a ticket at https://support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: The backup URL, generated by the Backup manager, on JIRA Cloud, is not available after daily maintenance.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Appears to be regression of:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43077
- But has alternate Stack Trace in Jira Log

"Add gadget" window doesn't display all gadgets available for an instance of JIRA.
There is no *"Load all Gadgets"* option in the dialog after 60 seconds.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# "Add Gadget" in a New Dashboard. and receive initial error:
{quote}
Not all gadgets have loaded
Were still trying to fetch all of the available gadgets.
{quote}

Additional gadgets have been found and can be loaded.
Load all gadgets

Try again

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Invalid character can be inserted in the Project Name when creating a Project or by editing the Project name. If an invalid character is present, the Creation of issues is broken because the Project List can't be generated.

The Create Issue window doesn't open. Opening on a different tab doesn't show the Project list.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Core

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project and paste the following: "Invalid character  here" (there is an invalid character right before the word "here". hex: e2 80 a8 [LINE SEPARATOR|http://www.utf8-chartable.de/unicode-utf8-table.pl?start=8192&number=128]) 
# Click on "Create" button to create an issue

*Expected Results*
The creation screen pops up.

*Actual Results*
* Loading wheel spins indefinitely.
* The following error appears in the browser Console.
{noformat}
Uncaught Error: AJS.Descriptor: expected property [label] but was undefined
{noformat}

h3. Find if JIRA site is affected:
The following search for non ASCII characters in the DB returns one or more projects:{noformat}
select pname as Project from project where not pname ~ ( '^('||
 $$[\09\0A\0D\x20-\x7F]|$$||               -- ASCII
 $$[\09\0A\0D\xA1-\xFF]|$$||               -- ASCII ext
 ')*$' );
{noformat}


h3.Workaround
Find the Project with the invalid character by running the DB query and rename it using the "Edit Project" option in the Project Administration section.
No reindex of downtime needed.
fields.summary: Project Name non printable characters prevent creation of Issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When switching 'My JIRA Home' to any option other than 'Dashboard', the switch goes through properly. The problem happens when switching back to Dashboard. The browser will navigate to the Dashboard but the change in 'My JIRA Home' will not save, and next time the page is reloaded, you will be navigated back to the previously selected Home.

h3. Environment
This has been tested with Chrome, Firefox, and IE. It does not appear to be browser related.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the upper right profile button, select an option for 'My JIRA Home' other than Dashboard.
# Click Dashboard as your home again.
# You will be navigated to Dashboard.
# Reload the page or click the JIRA menu item. Or, just close out of JIRA and navigate back to it.
# The home will reset to the other selection, not Dashboard.

h3. Expected Results
Home will be 'Dashboard'.

h3. Actual Results
User Home is previous selection.
 
h3.Workaround
Clicking on Dashboard twice under 'My JIRA Home' will both load dashboard and cause the selection to save properly.
fields.summary: Switching Profile Home Causing issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For JIRA Cloud Import to succeed, the "JIRA Export:" option in the Import Wizard must be a .zip file in the following format:
JIRA-backup.zip
├── activeobjects.xml
└── entities.xml

*Problem:* The JIRA Cloud Wizard is also accepting an .xml file, continues through the process and runs and import that fails because it is missing the other .xml

The following guide explains the process that an administrator has to go through to achieve the migration: [How to restore a JIRA Cloud application backup into another JIRA Cloud application|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+restore+a+JIRA+Cloud+application+backup+into+another+JIRA+Cloud+application] (improvements for this was suggested under: [JRA-59604|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59604] )


h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud Imports

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a Cloud Export
# Unzip the export in webdav
# Go to "JIRA Import" section and select any of the XML files

h3. Expected Results
JIRA warns that this is not the correct format and prevents the import.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA parses the xml file for previous JIRA URLs and continues with the next section.
No message on screens warns the administrator that the import will fail.
After starting the restore process, the following error is shown on screen:
{quote}
(!) JIRA access problem:  There is a problem with your JIRA access.
Failed to successfully import JIRA.
{quote}
JIRA is locked.
JIRA logs show:
{noformat}
2016-02-18 01:43:25,224 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO username 763x2958x1 14ji4ox 202.10.85.134,165.254.226.18,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/StudioImport!import.jspa [c.a.j.studio.importer.StudioImport] Starting FULL JIRA Import as user: username

2016-02-18 01:43:25,230 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO username 763x2958x1 14ji4ox 202.10.85.134,165.254.226.18,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/StudioImport!import.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Importing XML data...
2016-02-18 01:43:25,231 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR username 763x2958x1 14ji4ox 202.10.85.134,165.254.226.18,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/StudioImport!import.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: org.xml.sax.SAXException: The XML document does not contain the <entity-engine-xml> root element or it was closed too early.
org.xml.sax.SAXException: The XML document does not contain the <entity-engine-xml> root element or it was closed too early.
      at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler.startElement(OfbizImportHandler.java:241)

h3.Workaround
* Zip both .xml files to match the format required by JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Someone who is only an administrator is unable to view Versions in the administration page. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user, remove all the application access but make them an administrator.
# Create a new software project and make them the administrator of that project.
# Take that new project, and change its Browse Project permissions to users only that have Software Application access.
# Now if you go to that Project with the new user, under summary you can see the versions, but under the versions tab you get a 404 when trying to get the components.

h3. Expected Results
Should show projects versions

h3. Actual Results
The page loads with the attached image and throws
{noformat}
.../jira/rest/projects/1.0/project/undefined/release/allversions?_=1468888539127 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The cause seems to be because the Project Central Sidebar is not rendered, thus unable to get the project key, causing it to be undefined in the REST call

h3.Workaround
Currently no known work around
fields.summary: Administrator without Browse Project permission can not see Versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When subscribing to an issue filter (follow screenshot), the email is not sent for every notification. Example:
from 12 am to 12 am, every 15 minutes. It skips some of them without any errors in the logs.
h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.621.5 - OnDemand
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search issues > make filter with JQL > save the filter
 # Subscribe to it > every 15 minutes (screenshot with configurations)

h3. Expected Results

The user that subscribed should receive a notification every 15 minutes.
h3. Actual Results

Sometimes the notifications are not sent, no pattern observed.
h3. Workaround

[Cron expression|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/constructing-cron-expressions-for-a-filter-subscription-764478409.html] may work in the most part of the cases, but it's not guaranteed.
fields.summary: Filter schedule failing

fields.description: When I'm logged in the issue collector works fine. When I logout, then the form isnt't displayed it is loading for ever ...
fields.summary: Issue Collector works only for loggedin user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA does not send any notification when an user is signed up to receive notifications on this configuration: ‘Single Email Address’ within JIRA.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud
Version - 7.2.0-OD-05-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Click the pencil icon next to Preferences and set My Changes to "Notify me" - Do this for the user you are testing
# Create a Software Project or enter into a existing one.
# Go to the ‘Notifications’ of the project and add a ‘Single Email Address’ - Add an email you have access. *Note:* Remove the others.
# Reproduce the ‘Event’ you signed up (Issue Created, Issue Updated and so on) on the project.

h3. Expected Results
The system should send you a notification of the change signed up.

h3. Actual Results
The system does not send any notification and there is no trace/error.

h3. Notes
We noticed that the email comes out of the Mail Queue. Although it is not received by the user. 

h3.Workaround
We tested using the ‘Single User’ and worked normally.
fields.summary: JIRA does not send any notification when an user is signed up to receive notifications

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce

1. Switch JIRA default language to portuguese
 2. Create a new sprint in a project
 3. Start the sprint with the start date and end date
 4. Edit the dates by click a date from the pop-up calendar
h4. Expected Results

Date are set correctly
h4. Actual Results

Invalid date format error is shown

!create sprint witrh language portuguese1.png|thumbnail!

  !create sprint witrh language portuguese2.png|thumbnail! !create sprint witrh language portuguese3.png|thumbnail!
h4. Workaround

If manual changes the initial letter of the month from capital letter to lowercase works (see attachments)
fields.summary: Error data format when start sprint with language portuguese

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Go to _Project Administration -> Issue Collectors -> Add Issue Collector_
 # Key in all the required field and click _Submit_

*Current Result:*
 - The page is refreshed and returns to the same page without any error message shown

*Expected Result:*
 - Issue Collector gets created

 

You cannot create an issue collector for this project, because the following fields are required on the project and those field types cannot be displayed to anonymous users. If the field is changed to be optional or a default value is provided, then an Issue Collector can be created for the project. Not allowed fields: Due Date

 

*Cause*
 - Due Date is set to "Required" in the project's field configuration.

*Workaround:*
 - Set Due Date to "optional"

{panel:title=Update Tue 26 Mar 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}
This is also applicable for the *Priority* field.
{panel}
fields.summary: Unable to create Issue Collectors, because of required fields not visible to anonymous users

fields.description:
h3.Summary
When a user tries to attach a file to an issue collector, if they do not have a current session for the JIRA instance where the issue collector is located, or if they do have a current session but do not have browse project permission on the target project of the issue collector, the ProjectService will return {{null}} and the creation of the temporary attachment will fail with an error. 

We still need to get the project in order to use the TemporaryWebAttachmentsManager (we changed to use this in https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/VPP-825 as part of vertigo swarm), but prevent the NPE from happening.

*Note*: If the user with project access has previously login to the instance on a browser, the said user will be able to attach the attachments. 

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# In any JIRA instance (for example's sake let's say blah.atlassian.net), create a new project and add an issue collector to it (make sure one of the fields on the issue collector allows you to attach files).
# Paste the generated {{<script>...</script>}} into some page (see footnotes for one way you can do this), and load that page in a browser that doesn't have a current session for the JIRA instance that you created the issue collector from (in our example, that means that when we go to blah.atlassian.net in that browser, we see a login page).
# Try to raise a new ticket and attach a new file to the ticket.
# The below error will be returned {{Cannot attach file issue collector.html: Unknown server error (500).}}
# Attempting the action again will return {{Cannot attach file issue collector.html: Unknown server error (500).}}

h3.Expected results
Attachments should be attached to the ticket without issues.

h3.Actual results
Attachment cannot be attached and error message is returned.

h3.Workaround
No good workaround without relaxing permissions on the project with the issue collector.

h3.Similar issues
There is a similar issue with the issue collector where if you use Internet Explorer with third-party cookies disabled, an error message is displayed saying {{JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing form token. Please try attaching the file again.}} This was reproduced on IE 11.0.9600.18125. Using a different browser should fix this particular problem, but then the issue described in this bug report occurs.

h3.Footnote
h5.Example way of running a skeleton page with the issue collector
Create a blank html page on your computer and paste the {{<script>...</script>}} into it:
{code:html}
<!doctype html>
  <head>
    <title>Title</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <!-- your script goes here -->
  </body>
</html>
{code}
You can then open that file directly in the browser, or use Python to start a local webserver in the directory where you've saved the html page: {{python -m SimpleHTTPServer}} or {{python3 -m http.server}} and navigate to it in your browser (usually localhost:8000).
fields.summary: NullPointerException in issue collector plugin: TemporaryAttachmentsResource#createTemporaryWebAttachment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Custom colour schemes in JIRA Cloud are not applied but show the default blue theme instead.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.844.1

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to *System > Look and Feel*
# Update the *Header Background Color*
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected result
The header colour is updated.

h3. Actual result
The header colour remains as the default colour

h3. Notes
The colour theme details in the "Colours" section of the "Look and feel" page are displaying with the correct custom colours, but JIRA is displaying all the default blue colours for the header, link, and so on.

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 21 December 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hello everyone, Richard Cordova from the JIRA team here. Thanks for watching and voting on this ticket.

A fix for this issue was made to JIRA and released in version 1000.621.4 which reached most JIRA instances either on Friday the 16th or Monday the 19th depending on the timing of the release and the various maintenance windows. We believe this has now reached all affected JIRA instances.

There is a parallel issue that affects Confluence with similar symptoms but with a distinct cause. This issue is tracked in CONF-45576. In order to accurately report the status of the two issues this ticket will be resolved. If there continue to be problems with your instance please see that ticket to determine if it applies in your situation. If that ticket is not applicable in your case and the problem listed here is not resolved then please open a support case so that we can examine your instance in greater detail.
{panel}

h3. Actual Results
The gadgets remain blank
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No workaround yet

fields.description:
h2. Diagnosis

The following error is logged when executing a filter or accessing a board that uses the affected filter:
{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:210) [closure-compiler-v20151216.jar:?]
	at com.google.common.primitives.Longs.tryParse(Longs.java:337) [closure-compiler-v20151216.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.VersionClauseContextFactory$2.lambda$create$0(VersionClauseContextFactory.java:88) [jira-api-1000.98.4.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.VersionClauseContextFactory$2$$Lambda$1636/20316621.apply(Unknown Source) [?:?]
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1374) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:512) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:502) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.VersionClauseContextFactory$2.create(VersionClauseContextFactory.java:90) [jira-api-1000.98.4.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.VersionClauseContextFactory$2.create(VersionClauseContextFactory.java:84) [jira-api-1000.98.4.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$Sync.run(LazyReference.java:325) [atlassian-util-concurrent-2.6.2.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.getInterruptibly(LazyReference.java:143) [atlassian-util-concurrent-2.6.2.jar:?]
	... 477 more
{noformat}

h2. Analysis

This is most often observed when a filter specifies a version string which is later deleted. This causes a null value to be propagated to the clause factory which is not equipped to handle it. I believe the best course of action would be to filter out nulls, though this may have the effect of returning a different result set than expected in some cases. In the alternative we can choose to trap the exception and return a proper validation error that details exactly what the problem is.

h2. Workaround

Remove the broken filter and replace with one that has the outdated version removed.
fields.summary: Null pointer exception thrown from JQL VersionClauseContextFactory

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA import and convert to Atlassian Accoount from portal only customers fails with the error message "Failed to import user remotely" if a user has a special character (German umlaut for example) in their Full Name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import a JIRA backup from an instance where a user has special characters in their full name.

And
# Convert to Atlassian Account from the customer portal only user that has special character inside their Full Name.

h3. Expected Results
The import is successful and all users are created.

h3. Actual Results
Import fails with the error message "Failed to import user remotely" and the following error is displayed in JIRA Logs:
{noformat}
@400000005874faab25a43524 Caused by: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.ServerException: {"errors":[{"message":"Invalid UTF-8 middle byte 0x3f\n at [Source: org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteInputStream@53c43a0d; line: 1, column: 187] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.idp.model.Json[\"displayName\"])","isHtml":false,"path":null,"fieldIndex":null}]}
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Remove all special characters from Full Name, generate a new backup, and use this new backup to perform the import.

h3. Notes
Please note that you may encounter this error message as well if you have more than 1 user accounts using the same email address (even if the user account is deactivated). Steps are the same except you will need to update the email address of one of these users, then generate a new backup, and import it.
fields.summary: JIRA import and convert to Atlassian Account from portal only customers failing with "failed to import user remotely" error message

fields.description:
Here is the scenario:

A user creates a new filter and sets the filter permissions to restrict to a group that the user is currently in.

The same user sets up a filter subscription for the same group to receive emails on a regular basis based on the filter results.

Using the Shared Filters Administration page, this user then re-assigns ownership of the filter to another user within the same group.

The user then removes themselves from the group.

PROBLEM:

Any subscription emails that go out to the group now show no issues. I'm assuming this is because the original "subscriber" no longer has the permissions to the filter. But this seems like non-optimal behavior since the user is not the one receiving the filter results.

As an Atlassian Expert, I do a lot of configuration for clients like this and once our relationship ends (project completed) my username likely gets removed from the system, which I'm guessing would result in the same behavior.

Take a look at the email that the recipient gets as well (see attached). 
The subject line shows Velocity (or maybe SOY) code. That definitely appears to be a bug.

I would suggest that the permissions check on the filter run for the subscription email use the same credentials as the individual or group that is receiving the email, not the original subscriber. This would be more scale-able and would provide more longevity for active filter subscriptions.
fields.summary: Odd Filter Subscription behavior when subscriber is no longer permitted to Filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to [Monitor a User's Activity|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/monitor-a-user-s-activity-794198946.html], JIRA Administrators should be able to view the session data via Security sub-menu in the Administration panel.

Recently, a release went out that now requires System Administrator access.

Either the documentation is incorrect and needs to be updated, or the permission was removed inadvertently in a previous release.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.5.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Login as JIRA administrator (without system administrator access) and attempt to access the User Sessions via ~/secure/admin/CurrentUsersList.jspa.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Administrators should be able to access User Sessions in JIRA according to our current documentation.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA requests the user to login again, as they don't have the required permissions.

h3.Workaround
- Create a Support Ticket to request that Cloud Support provide any information you require at the time about current user sessions.
fields.summary: JIRA Administrators no longer able to access JIRA User Sessions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the username and password are put in the URL, they are not sent across the internet. They are translated by the browser into an Authorization: Basic header. The current behavior of JIRA seems to be: if it receives an os_authType=basic request that already has the Authorization header, without first receiving one that doesn't, it will send you a blank page, but it will set all of your authorization cookies appropriately so that if you refresh, your requested page will load correctly (without prompting you for credentials).

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.789.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Run:
{code}curl -i https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/AD-145?os_authType=basic -H "Authorization: Basic <base64 value>{code}

*Expected:* Returns the HTML content for issue AD-145
*Actual:* Returns an HTTP 200 with no content
fields.summary: os_authType=basic passing Authorization header in the URL does not work

fields.description:
h2. Summary

JIRA threw an error 500 when trying to re-index 'linked' issues from the issue that's being deleted.

So basically, if you're trying to delete an issue that has an issue link to another issue that doesn't exist anymore, via REST API, JIRA will throw an error as it is failed when trying to re-index linked issues from the issue that's being deleted.

From the log, you'll see this error:
{code:java}
java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: issue to index should not be null! at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.notNull(Assertions.java:25) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.lambda$perform$3(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:285) at {code}
h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 3 issues
 # Link them together (AT-1 link to AT-2, AT-2 link to AT-3)
 # Delete AT-3
 # Fire a delete REST API call to  delete AT-1
{code:java}
DELETE /rest/api/2/issue/AT-1{code}

h2. Expected Results

You should be able to delete an issue where there's an invalid issue link via REST.
h2. Actual Results

JIRA throws error 500
fields.summary: JIRA throws ERROR 500 when firing a REST API call to delete an issue that has an invalid issue link to another issue that doesn't exist anymore

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 21 July 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello all,

Different users expect different behaviour from a breadcrumbs trail navigation. Breadcrumbs can either indicate the trail of pages previously visited (browse history), or they can represent the hierarchical order into which the currently viewed page falls (site structure).

Turns out the browse history approach is favoured by some but difficult to grasp for many users.

In the site structure approach however, expected behaviour when clicking on a project name is to get to that project, not a board or some other page in that project. The question now becomes, what does "that project" mean? The last visited page of that project? The Summary page of that project? The Issues page of that project? A board in that project? Board views are currently only available in JIRA Software and JIRA Core, and in Software projects there can be multiple boards.

We have been and are still working towards a project-centric navigation experience in JIRA. I.e. the navigation sidebar revolves around a project, not its n boards. Boards are children of projects (assuming they are not configured to span multiple projects). I hope this helps as some rationale backing the current behaviour.

Other quick ways to get back to the board:

{{Use the keyboard shortcut *g + a or g + h*}}

Click on the Active Sprint/ Kanban board item in the project sidebar

Daniel Franz
Product Mgmt, JIRA Platform
{panel}
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to an agile board, click on an issue to bring up the issue detail view.
 # Click the issue key link at the top of the detail view to load the regular JIRA view issue page.
 # Click the project name breadcrumb link at the very top-left of the view issue page.
h3. Expected results

The user ends up back on the agile board and view that they were on in step 1.
h3. Actual results

The user is redirected to the issue navigator.
h3. Notes

This has only started occurring with the rollout of the sidebar when viewing JIRA issues. Previously when clicking on the breadcrumb, the user goes back to whatever the previous view was, but now when viewing an issue on the standard JIRA view issue page, the highlighted icon in the sidebar is always changed to the "Issues" icon, so JIRA considers the "previous view" to always be Issues.
h3. Workaround

Click the Active Sprints (or backlog, etc.) link in the sidebar instead of using the breadcrumb.
fields.summary: Project breadcrumb link always goes to the Issues page which in turn becomes the last page visited when project sidebar is enabled

- Attempting to Edit an Existing Filter Gadget, the Gadget displays the Edit Menu but the Gadget cannot be modified

* JIRA 1000.73.0

Tested in Browsers:

- Firefox 47.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a New FIlter Results Gadget to a JIRA Dashboard
OR 
# Try to Edit an Existing Filter Results Gadget

Filter Results Gadget displays options to 

h3. Actual Results
When the Gadget it added to the dashboard, a blank window is presented:

In the JIRA Logs we see:

2016-06-17 21:46:43.919696500 WARNING: A servlet request, to the URI https://INSTANCENAME.atlassian.net/rest/gadget/1.0/availableColumns?_=1466200003862, contains form parameters in the request body but the request body has been consumed by the servlet or a servlet filter accessing the request parameters. Only resource methods using @FormParam will work as expected. Resource methods consuming the request body by other means will not work as expected.{noformat}

In the Browser Console, we see the following Errors:

(Optional - If Necessary)

None

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing a comment that has been added to a JIRA Issue, or when in the Assign Issue Screen, attempting to preview the comment using the Preview Icon within the modal does not function. In order to replicate this, the page must be reloaded after the comment was created.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.1.0-OD-02-025
* Verified on Chrome and Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new JIRA Issue
# Click the Assign Button
# Type a comment and attempt to Preview the comment
# Observe the preview function not working properly
# Add a new comment to the issue
# Editing the comment and Previewing before reloading the page works as intended.
# Reload the page and click to edit the comment
# Attempting to Preview the comment fails

h3. Expected Results
Previewing the comment should work in all screens where available.

h3. Actual Results
Comment Preview does not work in Assign Screen and Comment Modal

h3.Workaround
Opening the Edit Comment Screen in a new tab allows to preview the comment. (Right click > Open in New Tab; Middle Click on Mouse; Cmd + Click)
fields.summary: Comment Preview on Edit Comment and Assign Screens Not Functional

fields.description:

Return a result with the details of the respective user

The REST API is returning an empty page with [ ] in it

No workaround at the moment.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sometimes when a user tries to view their dashboards, the dashboard is empty without any configured gadgets displayed. This seems like a regression of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-62035 which is affecting Cloud now.
h3. Environment
 * Happens on Chrome and Firefox.

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a *long list of dashboards* with couple of gadgets on each dashboard.
 # Go to the Dashboard page, click on one of the dashboards from the list on the left panel.
 # *Scroll on the mouse* while the dashboard is loading.

h3. Expected result

The selected dashboard and its gadgets will load properly.
h3. Actual result
 * The selected dashboard is empty without any gadgets loaded.
 * Error {{Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'left' of null}} is observed in the Browser Console

h3. Notes
 * Clearing browser cache or reloading the browser helps to bring back the dashboard with all gadgets temporarily
fields.summary: Dashboard fails to load with error "Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'left' of null" appears in the browser console

fields.description:
When you hit a JIRA REST endpoint, eg:

{code}curl "https://gcrain-aid.jira-dev.com/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-1" -u username:password{code}

with an invalid password, there are 2 requests sent to the CrowdAuthenticator. The first is JiraLoginFilter, second is JiraSecurityFilter.

!http://monosnap.com/image/03y3WQfkYHsGlekTR5MtZudnufbFk5.png!

This puts unnecessary load on the authentication service (eg. Atlassian account).
fields.summary: Duplicated authentication call when invalid username/password is used in REST requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When [Managing issue type schemes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/associating-issue-types-with-projects-802592389.html#Associatingissuetypeswithprojects-Manage_Issue_TypesManagingissuetypeschemes] the migration of 1000+ issue types times out. JIRA Cloud's smart-status refreshes the page every 30 seconds from then on to check availability, triggering the migration again and again. After a couple of minutes, JIRA becomes unaccessible.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On a project with 1000+ issues of the same Issue Type.
# Issue Types > Edit Issue Types
# Add a new Issue Type
# Remove the Issue Type with more than 1000 issues
# Follow to Migration Wizard to complete the migration of the issue types.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA shows a progress bar of the migration being done until it successfully completes and displays the result.

h3. Actual Results
Page loads for 60 seconds until a timeout error is displayed.
JIRA is unable to get connections from the database and locks.
JIRA may crash.

h3.Workaround
Perform the migration outside business hours when there is no user impact.
When the page times out, manually go to the home page to avoid the refresh triggering the migration again. The process will keep running on the background.
fields.summary: Migrating Issue Types crashes JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a workflow step is configured in the Workflow Designer to only have a global transition out, then no transitions appear in the workflow buttons on the issue's screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy the default workflow
# Add a new status/step(eg. Test) with an incoming transition(eg. to Test) but no outgoing transition from that step
# Add a global transition to Closed step(eg. to Close)
# Create a workflow scheme(eg. test scheme) and associate to this workflow
# Associate the "test scheme" to a project
# Create new issue and transition to Test status.


h3. Expected Results
A transition to the Test step should be made possible
h3. Actual Results
There will be no outgoing transition in Test step.

h3.Workaround
Add a dummy transition out from the final status with a *Hide transition from user* condition so that the transition will not be shown in UI.
fields.summary: If a workflow step only has a global transition out, no transition is available in production

h3. Environment

# Access JIRA without a logged in user

Show all the warnings

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a Portal Only user is logged in, all Issue Collector fields other than "Name" and "Email" will not show breaking all usability of the collector.

h3. Affects
* JIRA Issue Collector - Custom Template

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue collector using the Custom Template
# View the issue collector with a non logged in user. e.g: in incognito mode
# Log in with a Portal Only user
# View the issue collector with that user

h3. Expected Results
Issue collector shows normally because the Issue Collector is public

h3. Actual Results
Only "Name" and "Email" fields show for the Portal Only user but all fields configured show for public users.

h3. Notes
This does not affect the templates "Got Feedback?" and "Raise a bug" that show all fields regardless the user session.

h3.Workaround
Log out the Portal Only user to create the request.
Optional until bug is addressed: add a mention to the "Message" of the collector to warn Portal Only users of the problem so they logout. e.g: "If this form is only showing "Name" and "Email" please logout from <site-url> and refresh the page."
fields.summary: Issue Collector not showing fields for logged in Portal Only users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A condition (_Value Field_) that checks if a Number custom field is greater than a given value doesn't consider if the value has been increased by the post-function _Increase value of field (JMWE add-on)_ during the transition process.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.383.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On *Status 1*, add the following post-function: {{The value of the field *Custom Number field* will be increased by 1 unit.}}
# On the same *Status 1*, add the post-function {{Transition *Status 2* will be triggered on the current issue.}}
# Set the custom field *Custom Number field* to have the initial value of *1*.
# On the *Status 2*, add the condition {{The field *Custom Number field* will have to be greater than value '1'. Compared as Number.}} 


h3. Expected Results
To transition issue to the *Status 2* successfully since the custom field has been increased before triggering the post-function that transitioned the issue to the *Status 2*. 

h3. Actual Results
The transition to *Status 2* never happens.
 
h3.Workaround
The initial value for the Custom Number field must be greater than the one specified in the condition before you start the triggering post-functions process.
fields.summary: The post-function Increase value of field (JMWE add-on) doesn't work with a given condition
